question.text: Which of the following option explains the correct function of cortisol?

options.text: Reabsorption of Na<sup>+ </sup>and water and excretion of K<sup>+</sup> and phosphate ions.
To carry out glycolysis, lipogenesis, and proteolysis.
To increase cellular uptake and utilization of amino acids.

solution.text: Glucocorticoids stimulate gluconeogenesis, lipolysis, and proteolysis; and inhibit cellular uptake and utilization of amino acids. Cortisol is also involved in maintaining the cardiovascular system as well as the kidney functions. Glucocorticoids, particularly cortisol, produce anti-inflammatory reactions and suppress the immune response. Cortisol stimulates RBC production.
